havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.config_check module¶

class havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.config_check.ConfigCheck(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

_apply_custom_filter(selected_filters, custom)[source]¶

For each custom filter check whether it applies to this test and if does then add it to the selected_filters

_check_custom_filter(custom, cfg, user_filter)[source]¶

For a custom filter check whether it applies to either the settings in the cfg dictionary or the user selected filters

_covert_listdict_to_dict(cfg, filters)[source]¶

This method is used to convert the list of dicts to dicts.

_filter_other_logs(cfg)[source]¶

Applies filters to systemlogs entries in configuration data. Removes items that are in the filter list for the systemlogs entry

_filter_sel(cfg)[source]¶

Filters the SEL log and removes items that are in the filter list

_filter_systemlogs(cfg)[source]¶

Filters the syslog and removes items that are in the filter list

_parse_json()[source]¶

Read config_filter.json file in cfg directory and return its parsed contents

_select_filters(cfg, user_filter=None)[source]¶

Get all filters from the json config file and select the ones to apply for this test run

add_config_results(config)[source]¶

Updates the self.config_results dictionary with additional config results that will later be saved @config: Dictionary of key / value configuration information to store

apply_filters(cfg, user_filter=None)[source]¶

Apply filters to ‘cfg’ dictionary. Includes 3 types of filters: 1. Global filters as defined in config_filter.json 2. Custom filters if applicable as defined in config_filter.json 3. User filters (if provided)

compare_configs(start_config, end_config, filter=True, user_filter=None)[source]¶

Compares 2 configs and returns diff

diff_logs(diff)[source]¶
filter_dmidecode(dmidecode_list)[source]¶
filter_systeminfo(cfg, filters)[source]¶

This function is used to filter the global keys of systeminfo keys from the collected config keys. The systeminfo dict contains keys with values of different types such as string, list, or dict. So using this function, we handle the filtering of the keys depending on the value’s type.

Saves everything that was added using ‘add_config_results’ in a JSON file @param file_path: Path where to save JSON file
